Detailed Description

Class DataSourceBinData wraps a data source into the BinData interface. The DataSource-derived instance is given to and controlled by this class via a smart-pointer to ease the ownership problem of the provided data source.

Member Function Documentation

DataSourceBinData * DataSourceBinData::CreateInstance (  const DataSourcePtr &  data_source  )  [static]
 

Creates and returns a ready to use object of this class. The binary data is read from the specified data_source. If the data source is closed and can not be opened 0 is returned. Note, that the data source is not closed on destruction of this instance.

Parameters:
data_source The data source to read from.
Returns:
A ready to use object or 0 on failure.

UINT32 DataSourceBinData::GetLength (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the number of bytes which are hold by this object.

Implements BinData.

MemMap * DataSourceBinData::ObtainMemMap (  UINT32  idx,
UINT32  size
)  const [virtual]
 

Obtains a memory map from the given index idx with the specified size size. A size of -1 returns a MemMap to the end of data. 0 is returned if obtaining a memory map is not supported on the bin data object.

Reimplemented from BinData.

UINT32 DataSourceBinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
void *  buf,
UINT32  nbytes
)  const [virtual]
 

Reads byte_count bytes starting from the offset idx into buffer buf. Returns the number of read bytes.

Implements BinData.

BOOLEAN DataSourceBinData::Read (  UINT32  idx,
UINT8 &  val
)  const [virtual]
 

Returns a single byte in val at the given index idx. val is not changed if idx does not exist.

Returns:
TRUE if a value at the index exists, FALSE otherwise.

Implements BinData.

void DataSourceBinData::ReleaseMemMap (  MemMap **  h_map  )  const [virtual]
 

Releases a MemMap which has been obtained by BinData::ObtainMemMap.

Reimplemented from BinData.
